greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime factor of the Belphegor number B(n) = (10^(n+3) + 666)*10^(n+1) + 1.
comment: The Belphegor numbers (A232449), though not often prime themselves (see A232448), tend to contain very large prime factors and are therefore hard to factorize.
link: Stanislav Sykora and Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..64 (terms 0..44 from Stanislav Sykora)
xref: Cf. A232448 (indices of Belphegor primes), A232449 (Belphegor numbers).
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Nov 24 2013
